real_life_usage: This is a staple emoji during the Lunar New Year and Diwali, used millions of times in greeting messages and social media posts wishing friends and family prosperity.
Outside of holidays, people use it to react to an amazing song release, a stunning outfit, or when a sports team makes a phenomenal, game-winning play.
tone_impact: This emoji carries an incredibly loud, bold, and highly positive tone.
It signifies that an event isn't just good; it is groundbreaking, thrilling, and deserves immediate attention.
misuse: Using this emoji in a tense political debate or when discussing sensitive global news can be interpreted poorly, as the visual of a lit fuse can be seen as aggressive or inciting conflict.
It is best kept strictly within the realm of celebration and pop-culture hype.
professional_vs_casual: In casual settings, it is perfect for reacting to a friend's glowing selfie or celebrating a major holiday.

In a corporate environment, unless you are specifically wishing a colleague a Happy Lunar New Year or Happy Diwali, it is best to stick to more traditional celebration emojis like the Party Popper to avoid any misinterpretation of the imagery.
platform_appearance: This emoji universally features a traditional red paper firecracker with a lit, sparkling fuse.
Apple and Google display a single, thick red firecracker, while some platforms wrap it in subtle gold detailing to emphasize its festive, cultural roots.
